snippet.title: Don't put water in the microwave. #shorts #science #SciShow
snippet.description:
Microwaving water can be way more dangerous than you'd think! Here's the science of why this can be an explosive mistake.

Hosted by: Hank Green (he/him)

Emma Barratt: Writer
Rachel Garner: Fact Checker
Amy Peterson: Script Editor
Madison Lynn: Videographer
Faith Schmidt: Script Supervisor
Savannah Geary: Editor, Associate Producer
Nate Biehl: Animator
Daniel Comiskey: Editorial Director
Sarah Suta: Producer
Caitlin Hofmeister: Executive Producer
Hank Green: Executive Producer

Stitch Source: https://www.tiktok.com/@taylorinoregon/video/6814975800459169029 

Sources:
https://pubs.acs.org/doi/pdf/10.1021/ed077p1309
https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0894177702001929 
https://www.animations.physics.unsw.edu.au/jw/superheating.htm
https://www.thoughtco.com/how-superheating-works-609436

Music Source: https://www.epidemicsound.com/track/JNa5if2bCI/ 

Image Sources: https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/illustration/boiling-and-evaporation-freezing-and-melting-royalty-free-illustration/1369151764?phrase=water+boiling+point 
https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/video/water-bubbles-flying-in-super-slow-motion-4k-stock-footage/1307523025 
https://www.gettyimages.com/detail/video/cup-of-hot-coffee-tea-stock-footage/1298580060?adppopup=true

snippet.title: Why Tardigrades Are Awesome
snippet.description:
Scientists just figured out something NEW about tardigrades (my favorite animal) and it might help humans survive intense radiation. Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs going on...

Tardigrades are microscopic and totally awesome. They can survive crushing pressures, deep freezes, and decades without food or water. They can also survive insane amounts of radiation, which has confounded scientists, but now, they think they know how this tiny animal is doing it... and how that insight might apply to you and me. 

I just love these creatures. Maybe my favorite science story ever is how tardigrades ended up on the moon‚Ä¶ but that‚Äôs a story for another day, so subscribe for more!

This video is part of Huge If True, our optimistic series about science and technology. 

#shorts #tardigrades #animation #sciencefacts

This is a very interesting and educational video clip.
It seams in start that iron balls do a simple harmonic motions
But as the video proceeds, the viewers get mesmerized by the motion of iron balls. 
Although they are doing a linear motion independently along the diameters.
But overall it looks like a circle is doing a circular motion
This create a curiosity in the students minds and stimulates them to learn more about science.
This is a pure educational video and our purpose is to educate more and more students.

snippet.title: Reverse Reality With Refraction In This Easy Science Experiment ‚û°Ô∏èüëÄ‚¨ÖÔ∏è
snippet.description:
When refraction is involved, your world can be reversed. Try this easy science experiment you can do at home with a glass of water, a piece of paper, and a permanent marker. üßë‚Äçüî¨ How does it work? The bending of light waves as they pass through water causes refraction.

More Science Experiments:

Inertia Science Experiment - Learn Newton's First Law of Motion
https://youtube.com/shorts/wDGq6lgpC2E

Refraction is the bending of light as it passes through a medium with a different refractive index. When light travels from air into water, for example, it bends towards the normal line (an imaginary line perpendicular to the surface of the water) due to the change in the refractive index of the two mediums. This experiment demonstrates the principle of refraction and how it affects the way we perceive the world around us.

Among the world's largest science centers, the Museum of Science engages millions of people each year to the wonders of science and technology through interactive exhibitions, digital programs, giant screen productions, and preK ‚Äì 8 EiE¬Æ STEM curricula through the William and Charlotte Bloomberg Science Education Center. Established in 1830, the Museum is home to such iconic experiences as the Theater of Electricity, the Charles Hayden Planetarium, and the Mugar Omni Theater. Around the world, the Museum is known for digital experiences such as Mission: Mars launching in 2022 on Roblox, and traveling exhibitions such as the Science Behind Pixar. Learn more at https://www.mos.org/

#MuseumofScience #Boston #ScienceforAll #Science Experiment #Science For All, Science Facts, DIY, Learning, STEM, Refraction Experiment

snippet.title: Squid Ink Science Experiment for Kids #shorts #science #TuffTray
snippet.description:
Ink propelled squid science activity for kids ü¶ë

Also known as the Marangoni effect, the ink has a lower surface tension than water, lowering the surface tension behind the squid. As the water still has a large surface tension, it pulls the squid forward ü¶ë

snippet.title: Water defies gravity. But how?! üíßüëç #shorts #DrTatiana #science
snippet.description:
Water stays in a swirling beaker because forces of inertia pull it away from the center of rotation and toward the bottom of the beaker. We experience a similar effect on a merry-go-round or in a car when it makes a turn. This is a fun demo to try yourself at home. Just do it outside or your parents will hate me!

The presenter is Dr. Tatiana Erukhimova from Texas A&M University @tamu.

üëç LIKE and SUBSCRIBE for fun science content!
‚û°Ô∏è Follow links at linktr.ee/tamuphysastr

#funny #diy #physics #tamu #inertia

snippet.title: Mass & Density Hack | Science Separates Grains Perfectly! #shorts #viral
snippet.description:
Mass & Density Hack | Science Separates Grains Perfectly! #shorts #viral #physics #density #mass #sciencehack #scienceshorts #shortsviral #vyasedification #viralvideo #viralshorts #science

Ever wondered how science separates grains or particles perfectly?
This simple yet powerful demonstration uses mass and density differences to achieve perfect separation.
Learn why heavier particles settle differently and how this concept applies to real-life physics & chemistry experiments!

Perfect for students, DIY fans, and anyone who loves real-life science tricks.

snippet.title: CRUSH huge drums with atmospheric pressure! üõ¢Ô∏è‚úä #shorts #science
snippet.description:
A small amount of water in the drum is heated up; it generates steam, which fills the drum. Then, the drum is sealed, trapping the steam inside the barrel. When we  pour cold water on the barrel, the steam inside the drum condenses, and the pressure inside drops dramatically. However, there is still atmospheric pressure outside, which is now greater than the pressure inside. The atmospheric pressure from outside crushes the drum, and the drum implodes! This is a dramatic demonstration of the power of atmospheric pressure, using nothing more than a 55-gallon drum and basic principles of physics. Remember, don't try this at home!

üëç LIKE and SUBSCRIBE for more fun science content!
‚û°Ô∏è Follow our channels at https://linktr.ee/tamuphysastr

#funny #shortvideo #reels #foryou #physics #tamu #fyp
